messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]Does the laundry ever end, now sock, pens escape
messages.msgSnippet: Hi All: Thanks for the suggestions on the laundry... What I realized was that I have the suggestion that Joyce suggested a husband that does laundry all the
messages.messageBody:
Hi All:

Thanks for the suggestions on the laundry... What I realized was that I have
the suggestion that Joyce suggested "a husband that does laundry all the
time".... I think it's hearing him complain and dumping the laundry in the
living room at 9pm at night and telling me "that's the 4th load of laundry
I've done", makes me feel like I'm guilty for not doing it all... I think
instead of feeling guilty is to just say "I know sweetie, it's so wonderful
that you have the stamina and desire to do all that laundry".... Maybe he
just wants someone to praise him....

I wouldn't mind doing a lot of the laundry except the majority is his and the
boys. Everytime DH uses a towel it goes in the laundry.... so really looking
back on what I've written this is another problem for my husband to deal with
and not me (LOL)...

We went through this with the cleaning, when I said I wouldn't clean the
bathrooms and he could either hire a cleaner or do it himself. He moaned and
groaned for several months doing it (I'd never done bathrooms in our entire 7
year relationship) and then he finally said "let's get a cleaner"..... Maybe
the same thing will happen with the laundry....

As for sock, paper clips and pens.... they are all disappearing in my house
as well...

Dawn

"The only time my education was interrupted was when I was in school."-George
Bernard Shaw
